revised_title: Chromatic Behavior and Hormonal Regulation in Eels
tldr: The study investigates the chromatic behavior of eels and the role of the pituitary gland in regulating their color changes. The researchers found that the pituitary gland, specifically the anterior lobe, plays a crucial role in controlling the eel's melanophores and their response to different lighting conditions. The study also discovered that the pituitary gland produces two hormones, W and B, which work together to control the eel's coloration. The findings provide insights into the hormonal regulation of color changes in eels and other animals.
